category.name: Transposition
category.description: Transposition is a classic algorithm to encrypt plaintext or to decrypt ciphertext. By selecting this, you can analyse some ciphertext that was encrypted with the Enigma algorithm.
category.headline: Transposition Analysis
category.desc: Choose which method you want to use for analyzing the Transposition encrypted text.

input.name: Bruteforce
input.description: Select this to analyse the ciphertext using the bruteforce method. This method is ciphertext only.
input.headline: Transposition Bruteforce Analysis
input.desc: Input your ciphertext that was encrypted by using the Transposition algorithm

input.name: Genetic
input.description: Select this to analyse the ciphertext using genetic algorithms. This method is ciphertext only.
input.headline: Transposition Genetic Analysis
input.desc: Input your ciphertext that was encrypted by using the Transposition algorithm

input.name: Crib
input.description: Select this to analyse the ciphertext using a crib. This is a known plaintext attack.
input.headline: Transposition Crib Analysis
input.desc: Input your ciphertext that was encrypted by using the Transposition algorithm and your crib
